column1: # SOURCE: Trading Economics Egypt Minimum Wages (https://tradingeconomics.com/egypt/minimum-wages
#         Egyptian State Information Service minimum wage announcements (https://sis.gov.eg/en/media-center/news/egypt-raises-minimum-wage-for-private-sector-to-egp-7-000/
#         CAPMAS Annual Employment Statistics 2023 (via https://en.amwalalghad.com/egyptian-wages-surge-16-8-in-23-capmas/
#         ERI Economic Research Institute - Farm Worker salary data (erieri.com
#         SalaryExplorer Egypt 2024 wage data (https://www.salaryexplorer.com/average-salary-wage-comparison-egypt-c64
#         World Bank official exchange rate data (https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/PA.NUS.FCRF?locations=EG
#         Exchange-rates.org EGP-USD 2024 history (https://www.exchange-rates.org/exchange-rate-history/egp-usd-2024
#         WorldSalaries.com Agricultural Manager Egypt (https://worldsalaries.com/average-agricultural-manager-salary-in-egypt/
#         9cv9 Blog Salaries and Wages in Egypt 2025 (https://blog.9cv9.com/a-complete-guide-to-salaries-and-wages-in-egypt-for-2025/
# DESCRIPTION: Labor wage rates by worker category for agricultural operations in Egypt - Research data
#              based on empirical sources including government minimum wage decrees
# UNITS: usd_per_hour (US dollars)
# LOGIC: Base wages derived from Egyptian minimum wage progression (EGP 6
#        Private sector minimum wage for 2024 = EGP 6
#        The NCW established minimum hourly wage for part-time workers at EGP 28/hour in 2025.
#        Farm worker average per ERI data: EGP 60/hour (EGP 124
#        Skill premiums applied: unskilled (1.0x minimum)
#        Manager/supervisor wages from WorldSalaries Agricultural Manager data (EGP 161
#        Equipment operator wages from SalaryExpert heavy equipment data (EGP 182
#        Driver wages from SalaryExplorer courier/transport sector (EGP 5
#        Quality inspector from SalaryExplorer QC sector (EGP 8
#        Maintenance technician from SalaryExplorer facilities/maintenance (EGP 5
# DEPENDENCIES: None
# ASSUMPTIONS: Wages are gross hourly rates before deductions. Agricultural sector wages in rural Egypt are typically
#              at or slightly above minimum wage for unskilled work
#              Informal sector and seasonal workers may earn less than formal sector rates shown here.
#              Work weeks vary by season and role. Year-round workers average 40-48 hours/week.
#              Seasonal harvesters may work 50-60 hours/week during peak periods.
#              Rural agricultural wages are typically 15-25% lower than urban industrial wages for comparable skill levels.
#              Exchange rate uses 2024 average of 45.33 EGP/USD (World Bank/exchange-rates.org data).
# DATA_QUALITY: MODERATE. Minimum wage data is official and reliable. Occupation-specific wages from salary databases
#               (ERI
column2: SalaryExplorer) may skew toward formal sector and urban employment. CAPMAS surveys exclude informal

column1: #               agricultural workers outside formal establishments. Farm-specific wage data is limited; estimates interpolated
#               from general labor categories. Regional wage variation (rural vs urban) not fully captured.
# COMPARISON_TO_TOY: Research data shows similar ranges to toy data ($1.00-$2.65/hour in toy vs $0.84-$2.42/hour in research).
#                    Key differences: (1) Research uses minimum wage floor of EGP 28/hour as baseline rather than EGP 45/hour
#                    (2) Seasonal harvester rate slightly lower reflecting informal sector realities
#                    (3) Manager rate slightly lower based on agricultural manager salary data vs general skilled premium
#                    (4) Overall range is comparable
worker_category
field_worker
field_supervisor
processing_worker
equipment_operator
manager_administrator
seasonal_harvester
irrigation_technician
quality_inspector
maintenance_technician
logistics_driver
